alert.note: Alert for Creek; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 5:56PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Creek and southern Tulsa Counties through 645 PM CST... At 556 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Shamrock to 8 miles west of Kellyville to Bristow. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Bristow... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Kiefer... Mounds... Kellyville... Jenks Riverside Airport... Turley... Liberty... Gray... Leonard... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 187 and 227. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
